intro: Celtis planchoniana, commonly known as the Brazilian hackberry, is a deciduous tree native to South America. It belongs to the Ulmaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by spherical, fuzzy fruits. It is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Celtis planchoniana is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to tolerate urban conditions.
